hexsky.entry.ship_spells.entry: While various biological, mechanical, or otherwise media-infused creations are able to break from the environment, such methods are inadequate for all-terrain locomotion. As such, I have devised a way to assemble portions of the world as separated objects, allowing them to move about freely.$(p) These patterns serve as an intermediary between myself and such portions of the world.$(br)Useful terminology:$(li)$(thing)Ships$() are freely-moving objects which have separated from the world.$(li)$(thing)Force$() is an $(l:patterns/spells/basic#hexcasting:add_motion)impulse$() in a specific direction.$(li)$(thing)Torque$() is akin to Force, but affects rotation exclusively.$(li)$(thing)Variant$() A Variant force is based on the ship's axes.$(li)$(thing)Invariant$() an Invariant force is applied based on the world's.$()
hexsky.page.ship_spells.cloak: Toggles and returns the state of a ship's protection. This pattern acts as security for a ship, obscuring new references from being obtained. If all references to a cloaked ship are lost, it will be forever unobservable to Hexes.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.p2s: Takes a position and returns the ship that the position corresponds to.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.ship_pos: Analogous to $(l:patterns/basics#hexcasting:entity_pos/eye)Compass Purification$(), but instead returns the position of a ship's Center of Mass.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.ship_rot: Analogous to $(l:patterns/basics#hexcasting:get_entity_look)Alidade's Purification$(), but instead gets the ship's $(l:patterns/spells/ship)forward$() direction
hexsky.page.ship_spells.ship_raycast: Analogous to $(l:patterns/basics#hexcasting:raycast)Archer's Distillation$(), but instead returns a ship.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.zone_ships: Analogous to $(l:patterns/entities#hexcasting:zone_entity)Zone Distillation$(), but instead returns a list of ships.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.ship_weight: Takes a ship and returns its total mass.$(br)Forces applied by Hexes are multiplied by this number.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.assemble: Takes a list of vectors corresponsing to static blocks in the world, and transforms them into a separated free-floating object. Blocks outside of my ambit are ignored.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.force_variant: Applies a $(thing)Variant Force$() to the ship in the specified direction
hexsky.page.ship_spells.torque_variant: Applies a $(thing)Variant Torque$() to the ship in the specified direction
hexsky.page.ship_spells.force_invariant: Applies an $(thing)Invariant Force$() to the ship in the specified direction
hexsky.page.ship_spells.torque_invariant: Applies an $(thing)Invariant Torque$() to the ship in the specified direction
hexsky.page.ship_spells.force_invariant_: Applies an $(thing)Invariant Force$() to the ship in the specified direction with a specified offset from the $(l:patterns/spells/ship#hexsky:ship_pos)Center of Mass$()
hexsky.page.ship_spells.force_variant_po: Applies an $(thing)Variant Force$() to the ship in the specified direction with a specified offset from the $(l:patterns/spells/ship#hexsky:ship_pos)Center of Mass$()
hexsky.page.ship_spells.ship_scale: Takes a ship and returns its current scale.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.ship_scaling: Alters the scale of a ship.
hexsky.page.ship_spells.shiptoworldpos: Takes a position originating from a ship and transforms it into its worldly equivalent.
hexsky.entry.ship_wisp.entry: Ships are often difficult for simpler beings to comprehend on their own, so I created these patterns to direct wisps between them.
hexsky.page.ship_wisp.embark: Attaches the wisp to the ship. It must be near. This must be cast by a wisp; trying to cast it through a staff will fail rather spectacularly.
hexsky.page.ship_wisp.disembark: Detaches the wisp from a ship. This must be cast by a wisp; trying to cast it through a staff will fail rather spectacularly.
hexsky.entry.ship_moreiotas.entry: Developments in manipulating information justify appropriate ship-related patterns.
hexsky.page.ship_moreiotas.ship_slug_get: Returns the name of a ship.
hexsky.page.ship_moreiotas.ship_slug_set: Sets the name of a ship. The ship must be uncloaked.
hexsky.page.ship_moreiotas.world_to_ship: Returns the $(thing)World-to-Ship$() transform matrix of the targeted ship
hexsky.page.ship_moreiotas.ship_to_world: Returns the $(thing)Ship-to-World$() transform matrix of the targeted ship
hexsky.entry.ship_complexhex.entry: In the course of my research, I have found simpler representations of rotation inadequate. These patterns allow for more freedom, particularly in the pursuit of smoother movements.
hexsky.page.ship_complexhex.ship_rot_qua: Returns a ship's rotation as a $(thing)Quaternion
Sets a ship's rotation to the provided $(thing)Quaternion. The ship must not be cloaked, and the $(thing)Quaternion must be valid.
